title: @Morello Quick Question on MF's Gameplay...
body:
In addition to MF's Visual Update, is there any chance her E can see a slight improvement in functionality? By that I mean a faster cast time on her E...or a better way of using her E to slow her enemies? It doesn't feel that great, enemies are rarely caught in it/stay in it for more than one tic, and I feel like it it doesn't reward MF for the amount of time it takes to cast the skill. 

As always, I appreciate your time to answer this post. Thanks. :)

replies.body: We'll be bundling a small gameplay update with MF's visual update. Details aren't entirely finalized yet, it'll likely include some changes to Make It Rain though.

I hope it also includes a change to her Q making it just an AA enhancer/resetter, because a point-and-click spell that does NOT apply spell effects, DOES apply on-hit effects, and is the same range as her basic attack range (at least I think it is?) just seems redundant to me.

It's kinda late, but her Q have 100 more range (650 compared to AA 550) and it's a great poking skill wit how you can target the champion who standing behind minion, it's what make her early game so strong compared to other adc, changing to just AA enhancer will destroy her, and W already an AA enhancer anyway.

"Auto attack enhancer" means to make the next auto attack apply the effect...

He means that your next AA will bounce and hit the next target behind the first. It's the same move but it works with On-hit, Sheen, and etc. It's a buff. Not a nerf.

Since I noticed Miss Fortune is getting looked at, I thought I would finally mention a couple problems I am seeing with Miss Fortune. A lot of her power comes from strut and double up being quite limiting in their functionality beyond laning phase. Theoretically you can roam with strut, but most times the passive is just a balancing pain because it provides extra poke potential in lane to Miss Fortune's already strong early game. Past her laning phase, both strut and double up just become mediocre tools (double up is usually just an auto attack reset that doesn't bounce in dueling situations), so I am thinking these two need their design more heavily shifted from early to late game to fulfill the marksmen dps role more reliably than her current iteration. 

My thoughts:

Reduce her early game lane bullying potential by removing the current strut passive. The current passive does not fulfill any fantasy other than running faster to objectives and giving early game bullying so it is a difficult balancing issue. Tweak the current passive strut by shifting the impure shots passive on-hit magic damage to the current strut passive: the caveat being that strut only turns on once Miss Fortune can reach full stacks on an enemy champion. By cutting some of her early poke potential with constant strut movement, Miss Fortune can trade for better kiting and chasing so she can continue to hunt down her bounty with the fully stacked bonus damage and speed. The change grants her a much needed end game fantasy too since she can hunt down targets.

Since her lane bullying is reduced, double ups functionality should also change to be geared towards better mid to endgame scaling and bounty hunting fantasies. Add a self-buff to impure shots that briefly modifies the double up functionality from a bounce to a heavy damage single target cast which she weaves in-between autos - essentially two quick shots from each barrel - that have above average base damages and do not crit. Again, the current iteration of double up feels very underwhelming outside the laning phase, so adding the impure shots interaction to alter functionality to better fit the situation would make her feel better. The new function of double up increases late game scaling, which seems an appropriate trade off since the removal of potential strut poke in lane. Overall, Miss Fortune should be a stronger mid to late game duelist while reducing her early game bullying with the adjustment to strut.
me likey. have that with improvements on her E....maybe being a double charge Make it rain with a shorter cast time, and you have me sold! <3

All they need to do is fix her scaling since her magic damage abilities scale off AD and her attack damage abilities scale off AP. Your post kinda just says nerf her laning because she is a lane bully so does that mean cait, draven and graves should all be nerfed too?
Scaling on W would be nice to have as physical but omni's points are good as well. Both would be awesome!

If you read fully, I simply suggest to give her better tools in her unique passive and double up which lose their intended uses past laning phase. No other carry has such situational tools such as Miss Fortune's double up or strut after the laning phase. From a balancing perspective, I am saying give Miss Fortune better late game passive and Q but you can't keep her laning phase the same power obviously. The problem is not that she is strong early, it is that she doesn't feel satisfying to use late.

I hope Double Up gets some work. The RNG has always made it a problem spell and the last update didn't fix anything, instead it just made the targeting overly complicated.

A random idea I had once was to have the bounce become a projectile that always targets towards an enemy champion but since it's a projectile it can now be dodged and blocked if minions or another champion gets in the way.

I don't think Make It Rain is where she needs changes. I love her E, it's the most potent slow any ADC has. The problem is people should be maxing it second, but instead they max W second and deal with a low damage, low cc ability. Personally, I think (to start) she needs to have physical on-hit damage rather than magic. It makes it less confusing for enemies to itemize against her and ... well it just makes sense. It would also be easier to tune her around that change, wouldn't it?

Also, believe it or not Strut is a big reason she has her lane bully identity. Rather than needing to build boots at the same time as other champions, she can have a few hundred extra gold to get more offensive items. It doesn't seem like much, but snowballs start small.

Still, the passive is a defining key to Miss Fortune and I would probably not feel the same way towards playing her daily if it was changed.

Also the Double Up by no means is useless, it resets auto attacks, it lets you hit them from +100 Range, it's great for wave clearing and makes Miss Fortune a powerful duelist. While it isn't the best in teamfighting situations, it allows her to very easily kill a single target because it's an instant reset that does nice burst.

Oh man ive been waiting for an update on mf for so long. Here are my ideas for what could help.
1. Change her q so that it prioritizes champions, lower or no cast time or maybe even like an auto attack reset and it should be able to crit on both targets
2. make it so when you activate impure shots strut goes to max stats and cant be reduced for 1 second 
3.Let "make it rain" actually do damage or slow a bit more
4. make her ulti scale of ad

Sorry, but this would just revert Miss Fortune to her old, overpowered state.

Her ultimate scales off AD by the way, it applies 2 stacks of her W's passive which does about 12% of her AD.

I think her Q prioritizing champions would let her bully in lane too much, her Q has a low cooldown, low mana cost, and that thing can hit like a truck once you get BF sword. I just feel like they should prioritize champions over minions a bit more, like a 15% more chance to hit champions rather than minions, simply because I would feel like Miss Fortune would return to being an unstoppable lane bully.

Miss Fortune's E doesn't need more damage, she already has some of the highest ADC damage output, she literally doesn't need a single point more of damage, what she needs is a bit more utility on her E, not damage.
